trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Documents
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Documents

trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Documents
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Documents

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines the REST operations used to manage DocumentDB documents.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines the REST operations used to manage DocumentDB documents.

trans-unit.source: The document resource is represented by <legacyBold>docs</legacyBold> in the DocumentDB resource model.
trans-unit.target: The document resource is represented by <legacyBold>docs</legacyBold> in the DocumentDB resource model.

trans-unit.source: A document consists of user-defined content in JSON format.
trans-unit.target: A document consists of user-defined content in JSON format.

trans-unit.source: Aside from the required <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> property, users can define any arbitrary elements, structures, and hierarchies for the content.
trans-unit.target: Aside from the required <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> property, users can define any arbitrary elements, structures, and hierarchies for the content.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> element is a unique string that is user-settable and must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> element is a unique string that is user-settable and must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: By default, documents are automatically indexed, thus making a document queryable as soon as it is created.
trans-unit.target: By default, documents are automatically indexed, thus making a document queryable as soon as it is created.

trans-unit.source: Attachments can also be linked to a document.
trans-unit.target: Attachments can also be linked to a document.

trans-unit.source: For more information on attachments, see Operations on Attachments.
trans-unit.target: For more information on attachments, see Operations on Attachments.

trans-unit.source: As illustrated in Operations on Permissions, user access to documents can be managed via the permissions resource under users.
trans-unit.target: As illustrated in Operations on Permissions, user access to documents can be managed via the permissions resource under users.

trans-unit.source: This sample JSON document shows a catalog entry for a travel book.
trans-unit.target: This sample JSON document shows a catalog entry for a travel book.

trans-unit.source: The entry includes the id element, which is set to the ISBN identifier, the user defined elements, and the system defined elements.The following example shows an example of a JSON document created within DocumentDB:
trans-unit.target: The entry includes the id element, which is set to the ISBN identifier, the user defined elements, and the system defined elements.The following example shows an example of a JSON document created within DocumentDB:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique name that identifies the document, i.e. no two documents will share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> within a database.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique name that identifies the document, i.e. no two documents will share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> within a database.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the document resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the document resource.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: _attachments
trans-unit.target: _attachments

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path for the attachments resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path for the attachments resource.
